Key Match Events: The Mets scored 12 runs, their highest total in the 2024 postseason.
Shohei Ohtani and Mookie Betts opened the game with a single and double, respectively, but the Mets’ bats broke out to score eight runs in the first inning.
Post-Match Reflections: The Mets live to fight another day.
The Mets’ lineup took a far more aggressive game plan against pitches in the zone.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Mets’ offense capitalized on a near-Houdini act by starter David Peterson in the top of the first.
Reed Garrett gave it all back in the fifth, starting with a hit-by-pitch of Kiké and a walk of Max Muncy to tee up a three-run homer from Pages to cut the Mets’ lead to 10-5.
Others: The Mets have just the man they want on the mound, Sean Manaea holding the Dodgers to three runs (two earned) with seven strikeouts in five innings of their 7-3 win in Game 2.

The Dodgers have the next 24 hours to decide who will start that game — they unsuccessfully went with a bullpen game in Game 2 and would have Walker Buehler on four day’s rest following his four shutout with six strikeouts in the Dodgers 8-0 victory in Game 3.
